nodes.bodyText:
This syntax is indeed new to me.
From what I understand, all this will do is ensure that nothing remains for the interface after compilation time. But isn't that the case already?

In some cases.
If a module is side-effect free, tree shakers and bundlers can automatically import only the types and exclude the code.
However, if there is a side-effect in the module, a tree-shaker can't determine if the side-effect is intended or not, so it will include the code just in case.
The import type annotation tells the tooling to ignore any side effects and only pull the types.
Not sure I follow though. There is no code for an interface. Is there any chance you could point to an example or something?
Aaaaahhhh!!! Now I got it. Thank you. 👍
